{"step_by_step_thinking": "Shock is a life-threatening medical condition that requires prompt recognition and treatment. The common feature among all these types is the decreased blood flow to the vital organs, which leads to inadequate oxygen delivery. This decreased blood flow is characterized by hypotension, not vasoconstriction. Vasoconstriction would actually increase blood pressure, whereas in shock, it decreases.
